checkers

Class Playfield

  • java.lang.Object
    • checkers.Playfield

  • public class Playfield
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a playfield of variable size. It contains all methods that are needed in order to manage the playfield from other classes, especially the gamelogic. Therefore all methods have to be accessed from other classes and need the access modifier "public".

    We implemented this playfield by creating a 2-dimensional Figure array with a distinct size. The size describes the length on the x and y axis (Its is always a square) and not the number of fields.

    Author:
    Till, Marco

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Playfield()
      This default constructor creates a playfield with the initial size of eight and then calls the subconstructor to set up this playfield further.
      Playfield(int size)
      can be used by any superclass to customize basic required parameters

      • Playfield

        public Playfield()
        This default constructor creates a playfield with the initial size of eight and then calls the subconstructor to set up this playfield further.

      • Playfield

        public Playfield(int size)
        can be used by any superclass to customize basic required parameters
        Parameters:
        size - An integer that describes the length of the playfield on the x and y axis.

    • Method Detail

      • createStartPosition

        public void createStartPosition()
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a start situation from the resources. It automatically searches for the right start situation for the right size. If it is not found, then it throws an exeption.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown when the file containing the start situation does not exist or is not available at the moment.

      • clearField

        public void clearField()
                throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • setGameSituation

        public void setGameSituation(java.io.File file)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        This method tries to load a specific game situation from a .pfs file. This file type saves all information that is needed to reconstruct this game situation.

        The file parameter needs to be a .pfs file with the correct size in order to be loaded and displayed on the playfield

        Parameters:
        file - A file that respresents the path to a playfield save file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown when the file is currently not available.

      • setPlayfieldDisplay

        public void setPlayfieldDisplay(PlayfieldDisplay d)
        Sets the object that is responsible for displaying the contents of this playfield

        Parameters:
        d - The object that wants to display the playfield.

        See Also:
        PlayfieldDisplay, PlayfieldPanel

      • setPlayfieldSound

        public void setPlayfieldSound(PlayfieldSound s)
        Sets the object that is responsible for establishing a connection to the object that has the the task to playsounds. This object has to have the interface DisplaySounds.

        Parameters:
        s - A object that is responsible for playing sound with the interface DisplaySounds.

      • changeFigureToKing

        public void changeFigureToKing(int x,
                               int y)
        In this method one figure on the playfield changes from a normal figure to a king fingure by calling the figureType method with the parameter FigureType.KING in a certain figure.

        Parameters:
        x - An integer variable which is representing a point on the vertical axis of the playfield.
        y - An integer variable which is representing a point on the horizontal axis of the playfield.

      • executeMove

        public void executeMove(Move m)
        By calling this method a speficic move will be executed on the playfield. It changes the references on the field array.

        The method also tests if the move is valid. If this is not given the method returns without changing the playfield.

        Parameters:
        m - A move object that should be executed on the playfield.

      • getFigureQuantity

        public int getFigureQuantity(Figure.FigureColor color)
        Parameters:
        color - The color to test for.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of figures with the given color.

      • getFigureTypeQuantity

        public int getFigureTypeQuantity(Figure.FigureColor figurecolor,
                                 Figure.FigureType figuretype)
        Returns the number of figures on the playfield from one color.
        Parameters:
        figurecolor -
        figuretype -
        Returns:
        The number of figures with the given color and type.

      • isOccupied

        public boolean isOccupied(int x,
                          int y)
        Parameters:
        x - X position of the field.
        y - Y position of the field.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the field with the given coordinates is occupied by a figure.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns:
        True, if the playfield is completely empty (has no figures on it).

      • getFiguresFor

        public Figure[] getFiguresFor(Figure.FigureColor figurecolor)
        Parameters:
        figurecolor - FigureColor of the figures.
        Returns:
        Returns all figures the player with the given color has.

      • copy

        public Playfield copy()
        Returns:
        Returns a copy of this playfield including also copied figures.

      • colorOf

        public Figure.FigureColor colorOf(int x,
                                  int y)
        Parameters:
        x - X position of the field.
        y - Y position of the field.
        Returns:
        Returns the FigureColor of the figure on the field if there is a figure. Otherwise null.

      • getType

        public Figure.FigureType getType(int x,
                                 int y)
        Parameters:
        x - X position of the field.
        y - Y position of the field.
        Returns:
        Returns the FigureType of the figure on the field if there is a figure. Otherwise null.

      • getMovesWithoutJumps

        public int getMovesWithoutJumps()

      • playWinSound

        public void playWinSound()

      • testPlayability

        public boolean testPlayability()
        A situation is only playable when both players have at least one figure.
        Returns:
        Returns true, if the current situation on the playfield could be played.
